comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/27331537@N06] The Class 6 locomotive were the first to go into service after the New South Wales Government became responsible of the railways in NSW. There were only two locomotives in the classification - numbers 6 and 7 - entering service in March and April 1857.The arrival of the 23-class in 1865 displaced these little locos from mainline duties. The then worked Parramatta suburban services until eventually beling relegated to shunting duties in 1875. No 6 went to Goulburn as a shunter and No 7 ended her days handling coal traffic at Darling Harbour. Both locomotives were condemned in 1883 and were written off in 1885.
